text.section: Any applicant for a commercial guide's license shall be required to present proof to the satisfaction of the commissioner, in accordance with regulations the commissioner may prescribe with the approval of the commission, that he is qualified to act as a commercial guide.

Any applicant for a fur processor's license shall be required to present proof to the satisfaction of the commissioner, in accordance with regulations the commissioner may prescribe with the approval of the commission, that he has sufficient equipment and facilities to engage in the business of processing, manufacture, and storage of raw furs.
A commercial guide's license shall not be required of residents or nonresidents who are participating in field trials, training exercises, or other competitions where no game is harvested.

law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 173, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2002. -- Amended 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 239, sec. 5, effective July 15, 1994. -- Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 474, sec. 4, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 265, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 178, sec. 6, effective June 17, 1978; and ch. 384, sec. 36, effective June 17, 1978. -- Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 273, sec. 4. -- Amended 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 38, sec. 10. -- Amended 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 166, sec. 2. -- Amended 1956 Ky. Acts ch. 115, sec. 14. -- Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 200, sec. 28. -- Amended 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 6. -- Amended 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 68, sec. 19. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1954d-15.
